node.display_long_description:
Bigscreen is your VR movie theater.

WATCH 3D movies with friends in a virtual theater. 
PLAY your favorite PC video games on a huge screen. 
HANG OUT in social VR chat rooms.

We also host events like weekly 3D movie nights and live streams of SpaceX launches! 

--- Features ---

VIDEO PLAYER: play local video files stored on your VR headset. Supports 3D MOVIES in Side-by-Side 3D or Over-Under 3D.

REMOTE DESKTOP STREAMING: stream your PC's screen into your VR headset. Wirelessly play your favorite PC games. Play a movie or video on your PC and watch it wirelessly in your VR headset in a virtual movie theater.

TV Channels: watch movies, sports, comedy, and 50+ channels for free 24/7.

CROSS PLATFORM VR headset support!

Public and Private social VR CHAT ROOMS with up to 12 people.

Choose from a variety of environments like campfires and movie theaters.

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Version 107 (02/10/2021):
- Added “Desktop” or “Remote Desktop” options to the “My Room” left pane navigation
- Added geo-filtering for movie rentals to only show movies available in a specific region
- Disabled “Movies” button for users in regions that we aren’t able to support yet
- Updated the layout of the Room preview pop-up
- Corrected button indications for Index controllers in onboarding
- Various bug fixes and improvements

Version 107 (01/28/2021):
- Added 14 ad-supported free-to-watch movies from PlutoTV in honor of Black History Month
- Fixed a crash from headsets running out of memory
- Various bug fixes and improvements

Version 106 (01/15/2021):
- Added ad-supported free-to-watch movies from PlutoTV
- Added a manual reload button for the Public Rooms UI
- Increased automatic reload of the Public Rooms UI to 30 seconds
- Added description field to Public Rooms UI popup
- Flipped the horizontal scroll direction for thumbsticks
- Removed the "Holiday Lobby" and added the normal Lobby
- Updated TV Rooms "No stream available" message to explain more information
- Various bug fixes and improvements

Version 106 (01/07/21):
- TV: added subtitles support and fixed a bug with age-gated TV channels
- Videoplayer: added support for inverted 3D modes (SBSRL and UO)
- Fixed bug with Videoplayer and Movie Rentals where playback controls were always appearing on-screen
- Improved lighting in the new Drive-In Theater
- Various bug fixes and improvements

Version 106 (12/23/20):
- NEW DRIVE-IN THEATER! Enjoy this nostalgic new environment from the comfort of your home!
- New UI gives an overview of Bigscreen’s features, and makes it easier to discover interesting videos to watch and rooms to join
- For paid movies, available subtitles are listed on the movie info page
- Lobbies now support up to 12 people per instance
- Fixed embedded subtitle support for the videoplayer on Quest
- Various bug fixes and improvements

Version 105 (12/19/20):
- Upgraded servers to prepare for the holiday influx.

Version 105 (12/3/20):
- Updated the lobby with some holiday cheer!

Version 105 (11/25/20):
- Fixed room description and categories not saving across app restarts

Version 105 (11/19/20):
- Various bug fixes

Version 105 (11/17/20):
- Green Screen Studio environment is now available on page 6 of the Environments section
- Added more seats in the 360 Skybox environments, including the new Green Screen Studio environment

Version 104 (11/12/20):
- NEW: Green screen environment added! Now you can record and stream your Bigscreen avatars to Twitch, Youtube, Zoom, and more! Share your creativity with us in our Discord or Twitter!
- Beefed up our servers to handle a large influx of users.

Follow us on Discord to see a list of all our latest and past updates! https://discord.gg/bigscreen

nodes.title: Bigscreen Adds 14 Free Movies in Honor of Black History Month
nodes.body_text:
Hey everyone,

In honor of Black History Month, we’ve added a new Bigscreen Movie category called Black Cinema with titles such as Night Catches Us, The Long Walk Home, St. Louis Superman, The Pruitt-Igoe Myth, and more to commemorate the accomplishments of African Americans in every area of endeavor throughout our history.

These are ad-supported free movies on Pluto.tv, and can be watched on-demand at any time in any of our environments including our new Drive-In Movie Theater!

Check out 13 more amazing films in the Free to Watch with Ads category such as The King’s Speech, Memento, and more.

We’re also hosting a live event on Monday, February 1st at 7PM PT/10PM ET, broadcasting Selma, Ava DuVernay’s critically acclaimed film. This is a live, social experience, offering – a unique way for VR users to watch a thought-provoking film with people around the country.

Nominated for Best Picture at the Academy Awards in 2014, Selma is the story of how Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. led a three month march from Selma to Montgomery, Alabama in 1965, fighting for equal voting rights for all Black Americans.

Can't make it to the live event? We'll have more Selma events scheduled throughout the month. You are also able to rent Selma on-demand at any time at https://bigscreenvr.com/movies/catalog for $3.99 in the US/$4.99 in Canada.

To contribute and make a difference, please visit https://blacklivesmatter.com/

As always, we’re still working on some major updates for this year, including a new video/audio streaming technology, larger room sizes, ultra-low latency Remote Desktop streaming for Quest users, support for YouTube and streaming services, and a Friends System.

To contribute and make a difference, please visit https://blacklivesmatter.com/

Share your feedback with us on these new changes, features you’re looking for, and issues/bugs you experience! Let us know in our 17,000-person Bigscreen Community Discord or if email us directly at support@bigscreenvr.com.

#️⃣ Version: 0.107.0.8c2a1c-beta-ui-2020

nodes.title: NASA | Perserverance Arrives on MARS
nodes.body_text:
NASA’s Mars Perseverance rover makes its final descent to the Red Planet on Thursday, Feb. 18, 2021, at 11:15AM PT/2:15PM ET!

Perseverance will touch down on Mars at approximately 12:30PM PT (3:30PM ET). During landing, the rover plunges through the thin Martian atmosphere, with the heat shield first, at a speed of over 12,000 mph (about 20,000 kph). A parachute and powered descent slow the rover down to about 2 mph (three-fourths of a meter per second). A large sky crane then lowers the rover on three bridle cords to land softly on six wheels.

The rover’s new home is Jezero Crater, a large impact crater about 28 miles wide (45 kilometers wide) just north of the Martian equator. Jezero once contained a lake, which scientists think is one of the most ideal places to find evidence of ancient microbial life. If life exists anywhere else in our solar system, chances are, it might be at Jezero Crater. The main question Perseverance is trying to answer is: Was there ever ancient life on Mars? To answer that question, the rover will collect and store the most compelling rock and soil samples for return to Earth by a future mission. Once on Earth, scientists can use a variety of sophisticated instruments, many of them too large and bulky to transport to Mars, to help answer this question.

Landing on Mars is hard. Only about 40 percent of the missions ever sent to Mars – by any space agency – have been successful. Perseverance is only the fifth rover to attempt landing on Mars.

Watch this event live in Bigscreen! A dedicated channel will be Featured in Bigscreen when the stream goes live! You can also find the channel under TV > To Infinity and Beyond category.

Once you launch Bigscreen, tap on TV to find the channel! Don't fret if you don't see the channel yet - it simply means the stream hasn't gone live yet! Join our community on Discord at https://discord.gg/bigscreen!

node.reviewDescription: I love Bigscreen, it’s definitely one of my favorite apps on VR. But I’m a little disappointed with inability to share movies. I can pay money to see one of the featured movies with a friend, but if I want to invite a friend over to my virtual living room to watch one of my movies on my server, it won’t work. My friend has to have that same movie on their server. Why? What would be the point in that? Maybe I’m doing something wrong, I’ve tried to see if there’s a workaround for this. So far, nothing. But if you can collaborate and share your files on your pc in a work related setting on Bigscreen, why couldn’t I watch a movie with a friend who doesn’t have the same movie? They can’t record it, download it...it’s not breaking any laws. It’s no different than buying the movie at a store, taking it home and watching it with my friends there. During this quarantine, my friends and I have been finding out what movies we haven’t seen and watching them. It would have been nice to share a movie with friend that I have, that they don’t have. Just hoping this is something that gets fixed. It doesn’t make sense and makes the whole idea of watching movies with friends limited to purchasing tickets for one of the handful of movies I really have no interest in seeing. Maybe if they played newly released movies that would be in the theaters, that would be better. I’d probably do that more often.
